medical_history.chief_complaint: Inability to eat or drink for the preceding week.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: For the preceding 8 months, the patient experienced nausea, vomiting, abdominal discomfort, crampy epigastric pain, intermittent chills and sweats, increasing fatigue, loss of appetite, and recent weight loss of several kilograms. Symptoms gradually increased in number and severity. Loose, pale stools were occasional but did not represent a notable change from baseline. Factors that aggravated symptoms included potentially malabsorptive effects from previous gastric bypass surgery.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, obesity, migraine headaches, Roux-en-Y gastric bypass 5 years prior to presentation, laparoscopic cholecystectomy 10 years prior to presentation.
medical_history.social_history: The patient had been laid off from her job the previous year, smoked approximately one pack of cigarettes per day for 15 years, reported minimal alcohol use originally but later admitted to binge drinking, was a single mother of two children, and had not been sexually active for several years.
